results.title: Symptomatic Hypoglycemia During Treatment with a Therapeutic Dose of Metformin
results.text_hl: Within 2 weeks of discontinuing @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, there were no further "attacks", and the chronic @<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@daytime fatigue@@@ and @DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@somnolence@@@ significantly improved.

results.title: Efficacy of a Combination of Metformin and Vildagliptin in Comparison to Metformin Alone in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: A Multicentre, Retrospective, Real-World Evidence Study
results.text_hl: The current study showed that adverse events such as giddiness, @<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ and @DISEASE_Stomach_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D013272 @@@gastric discomfort@@@ were similar for the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ only arm and the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ plus @CHEMICAL_Vildagliptin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077597 @@@vildagliptin@@@ arm.

citations.NLM: Mohan V, Zargar A, Chawla M, Joshi A, Ayyagari U, Sethi B, Gaurav K, Patted URH, Bhagat SV, Mane AI. Efficacy of a Combination of Metformin and Vildagliptin in Comparison to Metformin Alone in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: A Multicentre, Retrospective, Real-World Evidence Study Diabetes Metab Syndr Obes. 2021;14():2925-2933. results.title: Metformin Attenuates Slow-to-Fast Fiber Shift and Proteolysis Markers Increase in Rat Soleus after 7 Days of Rat Hindlimb Unloading
results.text_hl: Thus, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment during @DISEASE_Muscular_Disorders_Atrophic @DISEASE_MESH:D020966 @@@muscle disuse@@@ could be useful to prevent the decrease in the percentage of slow-type @<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@-resistant muscle fibers.

results.title: Euglycemic Diabetic Ketoacidosis after Discontinuing SGLT2 Inhibitor
results.text_hl: We report a case of a 45-year-old gentleman with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes mellitus@@@ on @CHEMICAL_empagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C570240 @@@empagliflozin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_glimepiride @CHEMICAL_MESH:C057619 @@@glimepiride@@@ who presented with @DISEASE_Abdominal_Pain @DISEASE_MESH:D015746 @@@abdominal pain@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, and @DISEASE_Vomiting @DISEASE_MESH:D014839 @@@vomiting@@@.

citations.NLM: Alhemeiri M, Alseddeeqi E. Euglycemic Diabetic Ketoacidosis after Discontinuing SGLT2 Inhibitor Case Rep Endocrinol. 2022;2022():4101975. PMID: 35282610

results.title: [Cross-Sectional Study on Adverse Effects of Metformin Hydrochloride on 130 Patients Type 2 Diabetic Admitted to Medical Center and Diabetes Home of Sidi Bel-Abbes].
results.text_hl: Five (3.85%) @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ had a total and lasting intolerance to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MetforminHydrochloride@@@ leading to its discontinuation following persistent @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@.

results.title: A case of anti-HMGCR myopathy triggered by sodium/glucose co-transporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitors.
results.text_hl: We report the case of a 76-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who developed @DISEASE_Muscle_Weakness @DISEASE_MESH:D018908 @@@muscle weakness@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, and increased CK, following treatment with @CHEMICAL_dapagliflozin @CHEMICAL_MESH:C529054 @@@dapagliflozin@@@, a sodium/glucose co-transporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitor, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Stella M, Biassoni E, Fiorillo C, Grandis M, Mattioli F, Del Sette M. A case of anti-HMGCR myopathy triggered by sodium/glucose co-transporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitors. Neurol Sci. 2022 Jul;43(7):4567-4570. PMID: 35391603
citations.BibTeX: @article{35391603, title={A case of anti-HMGCR myopathy triggered by sodium/glucose co-transporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitors.}, author={Stella M and Biassoni E and Fiorillo C and Grandis M and Mattioli F and Del Sette M}, journal={Neurol Sci}, volume={43}, number={7}, pages={4567-4570}}

results.title: Glucose Uptake and Insulin Response in Tissue-engineered Human Skeletal Muscle.
results.text_hl: Treatment of myobundles with 400 microM @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ increased basal @CHEMICAL_Deoxyglucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003847 @@@2-DG@@@ uptake 1.7-fold and caused a significant drop in twitch and tetanus contractile force along with decreased @<m>DISEASE_Fatigue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ resistance.

citations.NLM: Kondash ME, Ananthakumar A, Khodabukus A, Bursac N, Truskey GA. Glucose Uptake and Insulin Response in Tissue-engineered Human Skeletal Muscle. Tissue Eng Regen Med. 2020 Dec;17(6):801-813. PMID: 32200516
citations.BibTeX: @article{32200516, title={Glucose Uptake and Insulin Response in Tissue-engineered Human Skeletal Muscle.}, author={Kondash ME and Ananthakumar A and Khodabukus A and Bursac N and Truskey GA}, journal={Tissue Eng Regen Med}, volume={17}, number={6}, pages={801-813}}
